timeline.bodyText:
On Windows:
$ echo hi
hi
$ echo "hi"
"hi"
So it depends on the actual command line. We could remove the double quote from the command line. I think that would work for both Windows and Linux.
timeline.author: fufranci

timeline.bodyText: the cmd command "cd" without any argument would also return the current directory.
timeline.author: fufranci

I was looking at:
FileAttribute
FileAttributeView
setAttribute
to see if we can add a method in the Platform interface that returns a FileAttribute object.
timeline.author: fufranci

timeline.bodyText: We could add a method that returns FileAttribute in the Platform interface.
timeline.author: fufranci

timeline.bodyText: I remember I saw these errors too. I think it was caused by too many errors (not failures) in the tests. If you have fixed the unit tests, you may not need this anymore.
timeline.author: fufranci

timeline.bodyText: Would java.nio.file.PathMatcher help here?  It may make building the expectation easier.
timeline.author: fufranci

timeline.bodyText: Serialized listener processor is the main thread in Context. Technically it shouldn't continue running after the test as the test should have closed any Context that it opens.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.author: fufranci

replies.bodyText: I think that the takeFirst should check and throw
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I am going to remove "Serialized listener processor" from the list. To investigate why the context thread is still running should be a different task.
replies.author: fufranci

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we should ignore this exception. We need to fix whatever the cause is.
timeline.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I will remove InvalidExitValueException from this list. The 2 sec wait in ThreadProtector may help overall.
replies.author: fufranci

replies.bodyText:
The exception is from:
org.zeroturnaround.exec.InvalidExitValueException: Unexpected exit value: 255, allowed exit values: [0], executed command [taskkill, /T, /F, /PID, 6932]
	at org.zeroturnaround.exec.WaitForProcess.checkExit(WaitForProcess.java:147)
	at org.zeroturnaround.exec.WaitForProcess.call(WaitForProcess.java:116)
	at org.zeroturnaround.exec.ProcessExecutor.executeNoTimeout(ProcessExecutor.java:818)
	at org.zeroturnaround.process.WindowsProcess.taskkill(WindowsProcess.java:109)
	at org.zeroturnaround.process.WindowsProcess.destroy(WindowsProcess.java:93)
	at com.aws.iot.evergreen.util.platforms.WindowsPlatform.killProcessAndChildren(WindowsPlatform.java:21)
	at com.aws.iot.evergreen.util.Exec.close(Exec.java:407)

I think it is safe to ignore at the global level, that is here. I think we only use zeroturnaround's kill process feature.
replies.author: fufranci

replies.bodyText: Yes, but this is telling us that it couldn't kill the process, or something. Whatever 255 means. This is a problem that we cannot ignore.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I think we should use our own process runner anyway instead of the zt runner. You can use the WindowsProcess to get the PID, then call the same command, but use our Exec. This way we can log the stdout and stderr. Maybe that will explain what is wrong.
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: It was quite hard to reprod.  But in one instance, we were trying to kill a process gracefully. Then waited for 2 sec and checked if the process was killed. If the process was not killed, we forcefully killed it again. The above stack was the error of a forceful kill. In this instance (maybe things were slower when debugging), the process was not there anymore the 2nd time when we tried to kill the process, resulting in an error. I made a change in WindowsPlatform.java to ignore such case.
replies.author: fufranci

timeline.message: Ignore InvalidExitValueException if the process is not alive anymore
Ignore InvalidExitValueException if the process is not alive anymore

timeline.bodyText: Nice abstraction. Like it a lot.
timeline.author: leaf94

timeline.message:
Shutdown kernel lifecycle after each test

If we don't do that, there is a tlog file being kept open, resulting the temp dir can't be removed, causing test error.

Declare direct dependency on a newer version of jna

zeroturnaround brings in an older version jna which tries to load msvcr100.dll.
msvcr100.dll is not shipped with recent Windows/VC redist.

Fix flaky tests on t3a.medium EC2

* Ignore couple exceptions in ExceptionLogProtector
* Ran into NPE in ThreadProtector. Add potential fix
* Test coverage drop to 0.79 on Windows.

Increase timeout for some flaky tests when running on Windows

* Also sleep a little bit in ThreadProtector if there is some active threads.
Run e2e only on Linux for now

Clean up

* Remove lenient = true
* Use Path.compareTo

* Change more workflows to run on Linux only
* Increase some timeouts to fix flakiness
* Another attempt to fix NPE in ThreadProtector
Ignore InvalidExitValueException if the process is not alive anymore

rename code style file for Intellij
Fine adjust coverage limit

* coverage adjustment
* port new code - need to merge this quick!

* coverage adjustment
* port new code - need to merge this quick!
Clean up e2e-test to run on Linux only (revert back to same as master)
